ja31:1.1: Apart from a couple of variant readings, this verse is identical with that from SN 11.6. | In Buddhist and Brahmanical literature, Mātali is the charioteer of Indra/Sakka. Here Sakka is telling him not to harm the nests, acknowledging the unacceptable ecological damage of warfare. | The commentary interprets kulāvakā as “nestlings”, but it refers rather to the “nests”.
